intro: Gireoudia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf gireoudia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture and botanical gardens.
